data.name: August meetup

group.name: Amazon Web Services (AWS) User Group - PITTSBURGH

data.description:
Do you have visibility into your cloud assets in AWS? Did you configure your S3 buckets properly? Are you integrating “Security as Code” in your DevOps practices? Moreover, is your industry heavily regulated and reliant on adhering to compliance protocols? Our talks will include common yet serious security risks in AWS, and how enhanced visibility and compliance rulesets can remediate them.

Presenter: Senior Security Engineer Chris Nottingham

Basic Agenda:

06:00 - 07:15 => Grab food, drink, and a seat
07:15 - 07:20 => Nate's opening remarks
07:20 - 08:30 => Cloud Security in AWS with Chris Nottingham
08:30 - 09:00 => Socializing and Networking

Doors will be open earlier for this Meetup for those who want to come early. There will be a post-networking “Ask the Engineer” social hour at the PA Market to follow.

data.name: October meetup

group.name: Amazon Web Services (AWS) User Group - PITTSBURGH

data.description:
Topic: Building .NET Applications on AWS

This session is targeted towards .Net & Microsoft developers/architects/development leads who are exploring or building applications with AWS .NET SDK Technologies. Learn AWS VS tools and .Net Core integration with several AWS Services (ECS, EC2, CloudFormation, SNS, SQS, Lambda, Step functions, Config Rules, CDK etc.). Also learn about how other AWS .NET application development usecases.

Presenter: Amit Jha Senior Solutions Architect, Amazon Web Services

Amit works as Sr Solutions Architect with Amazon Web Services (AWS) and has 17+ years of Industry experience. In his current role, Amit focuses on architecting on AWS, optimizing AWS environments and helping customers & partners with cloud adoption with special focus on Microsoft/.NET workloads. Prior to his current role, he served numerous roles at Microsoft for 11+ years helping large enterprise (Several Industry Verticals) with Cloud/Software architecture and development consulting.

Agenda:

07:00 - 07:10 => Grab food, drink, and a seat
07:10 - 07:15 => Introductory comments from Nate
07:20 - 08:50 => Session topic
08:50 - 09:00 => Q&A
